intro: Seseli saxifragum, commonly known as rock saxifrage, is a perennial flowering plant native to rocky and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in crevices and on cliffs. Seseli saxifragum is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to flourish in challenging environments.
